Text:
Good work on the training. Sorry for summoning you
when you're so busy.
No, not at all. How may I assist you today?

It's nothing major. I just wanted an update on the
trainees.

Their numbers have increased exponentially as of late.
How're they holding up? Are they training hard?

Indeed, we had many recruits join us last month and
train alongside our other trainees. However...

More than half of them are focused on improving their
core strength and are nowhere near ready for
actual missions.

...I must admit it has been a struggle. I apologize
for not being more effective.
No, you've done well. Don't beat yourself up over it.
But I find my own results far from satisfactory...

Then I hope you'll listen to my objective assessment.
I believe you're fulfilling your role as an
instructor admirably.

I don't expect immediate results. Furthermore, it
would be pointless if your impatience ended up
exhausting and destroying the soldiers' morale.

In fact, I'd prefer it if you took your time training
them how to be, think, and fight in the Shadow
Garden.
...I'm sorry. I seem to have gotten ahead of myself.

You're not perfect either, so don't rush and do your
best.
Sir! Yes sir!
By the way...why are you so strict on the trainees?

As an instructor, it's only natural to train my
soldiers.

You paused to consider your words, or did I
imagine it?

You speak harshly, but I sense a warmth behind your
actions and words—at least, that's my impression.
Is it related to your past?
...If I may, I will tell you my story.

As you know, I was once also a warrior. A warrior
lives and dies on the battlefield... They constantly
face death, no matter how powerful they may be.

Those around me were no exception. Many were killed
on the battlefield, none more so than my comrades...

They likely harbored unrealistic expectations about
war and death. I was lucky to escape with only the
injury to my eye.

I...may have unconsciously let my personal feelings
influence me in my desire to prevent my subordinates
from suffering a similar fate.

...Our enemy is the Cult of Diablos. The battle ahead
will likely be our most intense yet.

If I can alleviate their fears even a little through
harsh training... If I can get them to endure, it may
give them that measure of strength to survive on the
battlefield.
I've been forcing these beliefs onto the soldiers.

...I understand now why you've been so strict with
them. You're a kind person, Lambda.
Hardly...

That said, I disagree even more with your current
approach. Why make the soldiers anxious
before they even set foot on the battlefield?
...I don't know how to answer that.

Lambda, as I said at the start, you've done well.
That's why I don't intend to tell you what to do.
...But perhaps I'll give you one assignment.
An assignment?

I want you to find a way to balance your aim and the
will of the soldiers...
My aim...
Yes. I believe you can find that balance.

...Sir! Yes sir! I promise to complete the assignment
you've given me!
Good. I look forward to it.
Well then, if you'll excuse me.
Heheh. Hopefully, I gave her the push she needed.
